intro: Notodanthonia penicillata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf grass or coastal wallaby grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a perennial grass species characterized by its fine, needle-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, often forming dense mats or tussocks. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small fauna. Notodanthonia penicillata is well adapted to arid and saline environments, showcasing resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
